item.title: CrowdStrike 因巨大软件故障遭股东起诉
item.description: CrowdStrike公司被股东起诉，称这家网络安全公司隐瞒了其软件测试不足可能导致7月19日全球800多万台电脑瘫痪的原因，从而欺骗了他们。【原文：CrowdStrike has been sued by shareholders who said the cybersecurity company defrauded them by concealing how its inadequate software testing could cause the July 19 global outage that crashed more than 8 million computers.】

item.title: 锂价格下跌促使 Albemarle 进行新一轮成本削减
item.description: 全球最大的锂生产商阿尔伯马尔公司（Albemarle）周三表示，该公司今年将第二次削减成本，除股息外，其他一切都可能被砍掉。【原文：Albemarle , the world's largest lithium producer, said on Wednesday it would slash costs for the second time this year and that everything but its dividend could be on the chopping block.】

item.title: 美国航空公司跃跃欲试推出高级座椅
item.description: 高端旅游的需求正在蓬勃发展，美国的航空公司正急于抓住这一机遇。【原文：Demand for high-end travel is booming, and U.S. carriers are in a rush to seize on it.】

item.title: 因澳门业务复苏，赌场运营商米高梅第二季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 美高梅国际酒店集团（MGM Resorts International）周三公布的第二季度业绩超过了华尔街的预期，这主要得益于去年大流行病相关限制放宽后澳门经济的强劲复苏。【原文：MGM Resorts International beat Wall Street's second-quarter estimates on Wednesday, thanks to a strong recovery in Macau following the easing of pandemic-related restrictions last year.】

item.title: 波音 737 MAX 坠机事故家属称飞机制造商应面临更高的罚款
item.description: 在两起致命的波音 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故中遇难的 346 人中的一些人的家属周三表示，美国法官应拒绝该飞机制造商与司法部达成的认罪协议，并称政府应寻求更高的罚款。【原文：Families for some of the 346 people killed in two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes said on Wednesday a U.S. judge should reject the planemaker's proposed plea deal with the Justice Department and said the government should seek a much higher fine.】

item.title: Cognizant 上调全年收入预期，第二季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 本周三，Cognizant Technology Solutions 上调了全年营收预期，第二季度业绩超过预期，主要得益于企业转向这家 IT 服务提供商以实现数字化运营。【原文：Cognizant Technology Solutions raised its annual revenue forecast and and beat second-quarter results estimates on Wednesday, aided by businesses turning to the IT services provider to digitize their operations.】

item.title: 随着人工智能竞赛的白热化，亚马逊将加入大科技公司支出激增的行列
item.description: 亚马逊公司预计将于本周四加入谷歌和微软的行列，报告人工智能方面的资本支出激增，因为大型科技公司急于利用这一蓬勃发展的技术。【原文：Amazon.com is expected to join Google and Microsoft on Thursday in reporting a surge in capital spending on artificial intelligence as Big Tech companies rush to capitalize on the booming technology.】

item.title: Corteva 季度利润超出预期
item.description: 美国农用化学品公司 Corteva 周三公布的第二季度利润超出预期，主要得益于种子价格的强劲上涨。【原文：U.S. agrichemicals firm Corteva beat second-quarter profit estimates on Wednesday, helped by strong prices for its seeds.】

item.title: 由于承保收入减少和巨灾损失，AIG 盈利不及预期
item.description: 美国国际集团（American International Group）周三公布的第二季度利润增幅低于预期，原因是其产险部门的承保收入因资产剥离而减少，以及巨灾损失增加。【原文：American International Group reported a smaller-than-expected rise in second-quarter profit on Wednesday, hurt by lower underwriting income in its general insurance unit tied to divestitures and higher catastrophe losses.】

item.title: Carvana 预测 2024 年核心利润高于华尔街预期
item.description: 本周三，Carvana 预测年度核心利润将高于分析师预期，原因是二手车需求强劲，库存管理得到改善，这有助于该二手车零售商保护利润率。【原文：Carvana forecast annual core profit above analysts' expectations on Wednesday, driven by strong demand for its used vehicles and improved inventory management, which helped the used-car retailer protect its margins.】

item.title: 收藏品需求放缓，EBay 预计季度收入低于预期
item.description: EBay 周三预测第三季度收入低于华尔街预期，这表明市场对收藏品、奢侈手袋和手表的需求正在放缓。【原文：EBay forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, a sign that demand is slowing down for collectible items, luxury handbags and watches.】

item.title: Facebook 母公司 Meta 在第三季度业绩强劲后，预计第三季度营收乐观
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司周三公布的第二季度营收超出了市场预期，并对第三季度的销售额做出了乐观的预测，这表明其社交媒体平台上强劲的数字广告支出可以支付人工智能投资的成本。【原文：Meta Platforms beat market expectations for second-quarter revenue on Wednesday and issued a rosy sales forecast for the third quarter as well, signaling that robust digital-ad spending on its social media platforms can cover the cost of its artificial-intelligence investments.】

item.title: Arm Holdings 前景令华尔街失望，股价大跌 9
item.description: 芯片设计公司Arm Holdings周三制定了与华尔街目标一致的收入预期，但这令习惯了该公司竞争对手在人工智能时代更乐观前景的投资者感到失望。【原文：Chip designer Arm Holdings on Wednesday set a revenue forecast in line with Wall Street targets, disappointing investors used to rosier outlooks by the company's rivals in the era of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 研究发现，人工智能可能会使拉丁美洲减少多达 5%的工作岗位
item.description: 国际劳工组织和世界银行周三发布的一份报告称，拉丁美洲和加勒比地区有2%至5%的工作岗位受到人工智能（AI）的威胁，面临被完全自动化的风险。【原文：Between 2% and 5% of jobs in Latin America and the Caribbean are threatened by artificial intelligence (AI) and at risk of being fully automated, a report by the International Labor Organization and the World Bank said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 受益于智能手机的强劲表现，高通公司预计季度营收将高于预期
item.description: 受惠于高端安卓终端的强劲需求，高通公司周三预计第四季度营收将高于华尔街预期，并押注更多芯片将用于正在进行人工智能升级的智能手机。【原文：Qualcomm forecast fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, helped by strong demand for high-end Android devices, and betting that more chips will be used in smartphones that are getting AI upgrades.】

item.title: 美国议员寻求阻止中国企业获得太阳能制造补贴
item.description: 美国两党议员周三提出一项法案，阻止中国太阳能电池板制造商为其美国工厂申请补贴。【原文：A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday introduced a bill that would block Chinese solar panel makers from claiming subsidies for their American factories.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，华特迪士尼将削减电视部门的工作岗位
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，华特迪士尼计划裁撤电视部门的部分工作岗位，以在业务萎缩的情况下削减成本。【原文：Walt Disney plans to eliminate some jobs in its TV unit to cut costs in an eroding business, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普表示反对人人拥有电动汽车
item.description: 共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三表示，尽管亿万富翁、电动汽车制造商特斯拉公司首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）表示支持，但他反对每个人都拥有电动汽车。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Wednesday that he was against everyone having an electric car despite the endorsement of billionaire Elon Musk, the CEO of electric carmaker Tesla .】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司暂停飞往特拉维夫的航班
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周三表示，由于安全原因，该公司已暂停飞往特拉维夫的航班。【原文：United Airlines said on Wednesday it has suspended its flights to Tel Aviv due to security reasons.】

item.title: 阿克曼的美国潘兴广场撤出美国 IPO
item.description: 在对冲基金经理比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）在美国的新投资组合披露将筹集约 20 亿美元资金后一天，美国潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square USA）周三表示将撤回首次公开募股。【原文：Pershing Square USA said on Wednesday it was withdrawing its initial public offering, a day after hedge fund manager Bill Ackman's new portfolio in the United States disclosed it would raise roughly $2 billion in capital.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔近期物价数据增强通胀缓和的信心
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，近期的通胀数据正在增强央行的信心，即通胀压力正在重回2%的目标。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said recent inflation data is increasing the central bank's confidence that inflation pressures are moving back to the 2% target.】

item.title: FOMC 不改变利率，但为 9 月降息创造条件
item.description: 美联储周三维持利率稳定，但开放了降低借贷成本的大门，最快将在9月份举行的下一次会议上降低借贷成本，因为通胀率将继续与美国央行2%的目标保持一致。【原文：The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady on Wednesday but opened the door to reducing borrowing costs as soon as its next meeting in September as inflation continues coming into line with the U.S. central bank's 2% target.】

item.title: 交易员认为美联储将于 9 月开始放松政策，降息 25 个基点
item.description: 周三，交易商继续押注美联储将在 9 月份开始缩减限制性政策，首先在当月会议上降息 25 个基点，并在 11 月和 12 月各再降息两次，此前美联储承认在实现 2% 通胀目标方面取得了 "一些进一步进展"。【原文：Traders on Wednesday kept bets the Federal Reserve will start dialing back on restrictive policy in September, starting with a 25 basis-point interest-rate cut at that month's meeting and delivering two more like-sized rate cuts in each of November and December, after the Fed acknowledged "some further progress" towards its 2% inflation goal.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社：美国考虑对中国获取人工智能存储芯片实施新限制
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，美国正考虑最快于下月单方面限制中国获得美光科技（Micron Technology）和韩国SK海力士（SK Hynix）等公司生产的人工智能内存芯片以及能够生产此类半导体的设备。【原文：The U.S. is considering unilateral restrictions on China's access to AI memory chips such as those made by Micron Technology and South Korea's SK Hynix and equipment capable of making such semiconductors, as soon as next month, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 警方称，特斯拉在完全自动驾驶模式下撞死西雅图摩托车手
item.description: 警方称，今年 4 月在西雅图地区，一辆特斯拉 Model S 汽车在 "全自动驾驶 "模式下撞死了一名 28 岁的摩托车手，这至少是特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克寄希望于该技术的第二起事故。【原文：A Tesla Model S car was in "Full Self-Driving" mode when it hit and killed a 28-year-old motorcyclist in the Seattle area in April, police said, making it at least the second accident involving the technology on which Tesla CEO Elon Musk is pinning his hopes.】

item.title: 美国机构坚持 5100 万个安全气囊气体发生器存在安全风险的决定
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周三表示，将坚持其最初的决定，即 13 家汽车制造商生产的 4,900 万辆美国汽车中的 5,100 万个安全气囊气体发生器存在严重的安全隐患。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said Wednesday it was standing by its initial decision that 51 million air bag inflators in 49 million U.S. vehicles built by 13 automakers pose serious safety risks.】

item.title: 意大利 Bending Spoons 收购文件共享服务 WeTransfer
item.description: 意大利应用程序开发商 Bending Spoons 周三发表联合声明称，公司已收购文件共享平台 WeTransfer。【原文：Italian app developer Bending Spoons has bought file-sharing platform WeTransfer, the companies said in a joint statement on Wednesday, as the Milan-based tech company presses ahead with a string of deals for software firms.】

item.title: CarShield 因欺骗性广告（包括名人广告）被美国联邦贸易委员会罚款
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（U.S. Federal Trade Commission）周三表示，CarShield 已同意以 1,000 万美元的和解协议解决其车辆服务合同欺骗性广告的指控，并被禁止允许 Ice-T 等名人代言人进行不实陈述。【原文：CarShield has agreed to a $10 million settlement to resolve charges of deceptive advertising of its vehicle service contracts, and has been barred from allowing misrepresentations by celebrity endorsers like Ice-T, the U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国参议员将提出法案，要求联邦航空局开展新的安全工作
item.description: 美国参议院商务委员会主席玛丽亚-坎特韦尔（Maria Cantwell）表示，在联邦航空管理局对波音公司的监管行动引发质疑后，她计划于周四提出立法，要求联邦航空管理局采用先进的安全措施。【原文：U.S. Senate Commerce Committee chair Maria Cantwell said she plans to introduce legislation on Thursday to require the Federal Aviation Administration to use advanced safety measures after its actions overseeing Boeing have raised questions.】

item.title: 日本央行的转变引发日元震荡，并导致对热门外汇交易的重新评估
item.description: 日本央行将利率上调至15年来的最高点，使日元兑美元汇率飙升至3月以来的最强水平，并有望进一步走高，因为投资者正在重新评估利差交易，而这一度是今年最受欢迎的交易品种。【原文：The Bank of Japan's move to raise interest rates to their highest in 15 years has jolted the yen to its strongest against the dollar since March and left it poised for further gains, as investors reassess carry trades, once the year's favoured play.】
